Fetchers#

Download academic papers from various sources.

Base#

class papercutter.fetchers.base.Document[source]#

Represents a fetched academic document.

path: Path#
title: Optional[str] = None#
authors: list[str]#
abstract: Optional[str] = None#
doi: Optional[str] = None#
arxiv_id: Optional[str] = None#
source_url: Optional[str] = None#
fetched_at: datetime#
extra_metadata: dict[str, Any]#
property exists: bool#

Check if the document file exists.

to_metadata_dict()[source]#

Convert document metadata to a dictionary for JSON export.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

Returns:

Dictionary with all document metadata.

save_metadata(output_path=None)[source]#

Save metadata as a JSON sidecar file.

Parameters:

output_path (Optional[Path]) – Path for the metadata file. If None, uses the PDF path with .meta.json extension.

Return type:

Path

Returns:

Path to the saved metadata file.

__init__(path, title=None, authors=<factory>, abstract=None, doi=None, arxiv_id=None, source_url=None, fetched_at=<factory>, extra_metadata=<factory>)#
Parameters:

  • path (Path)

  • title (str | None)

  • authors (list[str])

  • abstract (str | None)

  • doi (str | None)

  • arxiv_id (str | None)

  • source_url (str | None)

  • fetched_at (datetime)

  • extra_metadata (dict[str, Any])

Return type:

None

class papercutter.fetchers.base.BaseFetcher[source]#

Abstract base class for paper fetchers.

abstractmethod can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Parameters:

identifier (str) – Paper identifier (ID, URL, DOI, etc.)

Return type:

bool

Returns:

True if this fetcher can handle the identifier.

abstractmethod fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch the paper and return a Document.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – Paper identifier.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

  • **kwargs – Additional fetcher-specific options.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

async fetch_async(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch the paper asynchronously.

Default implementation calls the synchronous fetch method. Override in subclasses for true async support.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – Paper identifier.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

  • **kwargs – Additional fetcher-specific options.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

normalize_id(identifier)[source]#

Normalize the identifier format.

Override in subclasses if needed.

Parameters:

identifier (str) – Raw identifier.

Return type:

str

Returns:

Normalized identifier.

Implementations#

ArxivFetcher - 2301.00001, hep-th/9901001

class papercutter.fetchers.arxiv.ArxivFetcher[source]#

Fetch papers from arXiv.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:arxiv:)?(\\d{4}\\.\\d{4,5})(v\\d+)?$', re.IGNORECASE)#
OLD_PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:arxiv:)?([a-z-]+/\\d{7})$', re.IGNORECASE)#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

normalize_id(identifier)[source]#

Normalize arXiv ID to standard format.

Return type:

str

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch paper from arXiv.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – arXiv paper ID.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

Raises:

  • PaperNotFoundError – If paper not found on arXiv.

  • FetchError – If download fails.

async fetch_async(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Fetch paper from arXiv asynchronously.

The underlying arXiv client is synchronous, so this method runs the blocking fetch in a background thread.

Return type:

Document

Parameters:

  • identifier (str)

  • output_dir (Path)

DOIFetcher - 10.1257/aer.20180779

class papercutter.fetchers.doi.DOIFetcher[source]#

Resolve DOIs and fetch papers.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:doi:|https?://(?:dx\\.)?doi\\.org/)?(10\\.\\d{4,}/[^\\s]+)$', re.IGNORECASE)#
CROSSREF_API = 'https://api.crossref.org/works'#
DOI_RESOLVER = 'https://doi.org'#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

normalize_id(identifier)[source]#

Normalize DOI to standard format (just the DOI, no prefix).

Return type:

str

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Resolve DOI and attempt to fetch paper.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – DOI identifier.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path and metadata.

Raises:

  • PaperNotFoundError – If DOI cannot be resolved.

  • FetchError – If download fails.

async fetch_async(identifier, output_dir, **kwargs)[source]#

Resolve DOI and fetch paper asynchronously.

Document

  • output_dir (Path)

SSRNFetcher - 3550274

class papercutter.fetchers.ssrn.SSRNFetcher[source]#

Fetch papers from SSRN.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:ssrn[:\\-]?(?:id)?)?(\\d{6,8})$', re.IGNORECASE)#
ABSTRACT_URL = 'https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm'#
PDF_URL = 'https://papers.ssrn.com/sol3/Delivery.cfm'#

NBERFetcher - w29000, 29000

class papercutter.fetchers.nber.NBERFetcher[source]#

Fetch working papers from NBER.

PATTERN = re.compile('^(?:nber:)?[wW]?(\\d{4,6})$', re.IGNORECASE)#
PAPER_URL = 'https://www.nber.org/papers/w{paper_id}'#
PDF_URL = 'https://www.nber.org/system/files/working_papers/w{paper_id}/w{paper_id}.pdf'#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

identifier (str)

str

identifier (str)

URLFetcher - Direct URLs

class papercutter.fetchers.url.URLFetcher[source]#

Fetch papers from direct URLs.

URL_PATTERN = re.compile('^https?://', re.IGNORECASE)#
can_handle(identifier)[source]#

Check if this fetcher can handle the given identifier.

Return type:

bool

Parameters:

identifier (str)

fetch(identifier, output_dir, name=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Download paper from URL.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – URL to download from.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

  • name (Optional[str]) – Optional custom filename (without extension).

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path.

Raises:

FetchError – If download fails.

async fetch_async(identifier, output_dir, name=None, **kwargs)[source]#

Download paper from URL asynchronously.

Parameters:

  • identifier (str) – URL to download from.

  • output_dir (Path) – Directory to save the downloaded PDF.

  • name (Optional[str]) – Optional custom filename (without extension).

Return type:

Document

Returns:

Document object with path.

Raises:

FetchError – If download fails.
